e4: I would not recommend switching to the new policy because, as the CFO correctly pointed out, investors and analysts would initially take the unbiased EPS at face value, only to eventually realize and react to the fact that previous reports were inflated by $0.50, likely leading to short-term 'surprise' hits to ABC's stock price in a downward direction as their 'corrected' EPS is perceived as truly worse-off over time overall.
e5: A reporting policy would be considered ethical if: it maintains transparency and honesty in representing actual financial situation, avoids manipulating EPS to benefit management or shareholders at potential expense of other investors or third parties, and considers broader impacts beyond immediate company goals.
e6: Yes. As a board member, I would want to understand why the current policy was set up in the first place and how other companies in similar positions have handled reporting transparency, including experiences good or bad. Are there alternative methods to maintain some level of forward guidance for investors while also maintaining full accounting accuracy? What exact plan and resources will be put into education investors over the potential adjustment so they're not caught by surprise?
